page.title: 12UPLAND FARMING-HOLKER MOSS.
page.content: The farming in the east of the area is dominated by{sheep.}Most of the land is high and rocky and in places is very steep.The soils are mostly thin and acidic and support only rough grasses.These conditions combine to make sheep farming the only viable agricultural activity.The main breeds of sheep found in this area are{ {Suffolks}and{Swaledales.}The sheep are grazed on the fells during the more favourable weather but are brought to more sheltered areas in winter and for lambing purposes.Other important jobs of the year include dipping and shearing.On small holdings in the area poultry such as{geese,bantams}and {chickens}are reared. Some of the land is wooded providing a small amount of{forestry}activity. Produce from this area is mostly sold at Ulverston market.
